recodification of the general and permanent ordinances of the city of jesup georgia source materials used in the preparation of the the 1976 as supplemented ordinances subsequently adopted by the board of commissioners the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this the reader can locate any section of the 1976 as supplemented and any subsequent ordinance included herein the chapters of the been conveniently arranged in alphabetical order and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage notes which tie related sections of the which refer to relevant state law have been included a table listing the state law citations and setting forth their location within the included at the back of this system the chapter and section numbering system used in this the same system used in many state and local government codes each section number consists of two parts separated by a dash the figure before the dash refers to the chapter number and the figure after the dash refers to the position of the section within the chapter thus the second section of chapter 1 is numbered 12 and the first section of chapter 6 is 61 under this system each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections can be inserted in their proper place by using the decimal system for amendments for example if new material consisting of one section that would logically come between sections 61 and 62 is desired to be added such new section would be numbered 615 new articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or in the case of articles may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject and in the case of divisions may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject the next successive number shall be assigned to the new article or division new chapters may be included by using one of the reserved chapter numbers care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters page numbering system the page numbering system used in this a prefix system the letters to the left of the colon are an abbreviation which represents a certain portion of the volume the number to the right of the colon represents the number of the page in that portion in the case of a chapter of the the number to the left of the colon indicates the number of the chapter in the case of an appendix to the the letter immediately to the left of the colon indicates the letter of the appendix the following are typical parts of codes of ordinances which may or may not appear in this this time and their corresponding prefixes charter cht1 charter comparative table chtct1 code cd code appendix cda1 code comparative tables cct1 state law reference table slt1 charter index chti1 code index cdi1 indexes the indexes have been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of which are couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by local government officials and employees there are numerous cross references within the indexes themselves which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which the user is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this publication is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing of the publication with this system the publication will be kept uptodate subsequent amendatory legislation will be properly edited and the affected page or pages will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the publication with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages keeping this publication uptodate at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the publication as revised pages are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments this publication was under the direct supervision of roger d merriam senior leesa hampton editor of the municipal tallahassee florida credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publishers staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project the publisher is most grateful to mike deal city manager and onda woodard city clerk for their cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this publication it is hoped that their efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a ordinances which will make the active law of the city readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the daytoday administration of the citys published by municipal consisting of chapters 1 each inclusive is adopted all ordinances of a general and permanent nature enacted on or before  and not included in the recognized and continued in force by reference therein are repealed the repeal provided for in section 2 hereof shall not be construed to revive any ordinance or part thereof that has been repealed by a subsequent ordinance that is repealed by this article unless another penalty is expressly provided every person convicted of a violation of any provision of the any ordinance rule or regulation adopted or issued in pursuance thereof shall be punished by a fine not to exceed $100000 and imprisonment in the city or county jail and work and labor on the streets or public works of the city whether within or without the corporate limits not exceeding 180 days or both a fine and sentence of imprisonment and labor  and all sentences may be in the alternative and fines may be imposed with the alternative of sentence to imprisonment and labor if the fines are not paid each act of violation and each day upon which any such violation shall continue or occur shall constitute a separate offense the penalty provided by this section unless another penalty is expressly provided shall apply to the amendment of any whether or not such penalty is reenacted in the amendatory ordinance in addition to the penalty prescribed above the city may pursue other remedies such as abatement of nuisances injunctive relief and revocation of licenses or permits additions or amendments to the passed in such form as to indicate the intention of the city to make the same a part of the be deemed to be incorporated in the so that reference to the the additions and amendments ordinances adopted after  that amend or refer to include 22 1 include 23 2 omit 23 part i  charter footnotes  1  editors note this charter of the city of jesup georgia enacted by an ordinance adopted  amended the former jesup new charter no 34 in its entirety to read as herein set out former charter  1134 derived from act no 34 of georgia laws of 19378  et seq approved  amendments to the charter are indicated by notes following the affected sections showing the source of such amendments obvious misspellings and punctuation errors have been corrected without notation additions for clarity and indicated by brackets amended and restated charter article 1  incorporation and powers 11  name the city of jesup georgia and the inhabitants thereof are reincorporated by the enactment of this amended and restated charter and are hereby again constituted and declared a body politic and corporate under the name and style of the city of jesup georgia and by that name shall have perpetual succession  12  charter this amendment shall constitute the amended and restated charter of the city of jesup georgia adopted by the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup georgia also the city pursuant to the municipal home rule act of 1965 at ga code ann  36351 2016 et seq and other applicable provisions of georgia law hereinafter the charter the city of jesup georgia in the county of wayne and the inhabitants thereof are constituted and declared a body politic and corporate under the same name and style of the city of jesup and by that name shall have perpetual duration and succession in addition to those other powers rights and privileges set forth in this charter and as otherwise may exist under the general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia or the city of jesup may contract and be contracted with sue and be sued plead and be impleaded in all courts of law and equity make and enact by and mayor and board of commissioners ordinances resolutions bylaws rules regulations policies and procedures use a common seal and in all actions whatsoever exercise enjoy employ and implement any and all other powers rights and privileges incident to municipal corporations of this state or cites thereof as authorized by and under the general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia or the acts of the georgia general assembly or the constitution of the state of georgia  13  corporate limits the boundaries of this city shall be those existing on the effective date of the adoption of this charter with such alterations as may be made from time to time in a manner provided by law specifically the corporate limits of the city of jesup shall extend to and embrace all of the following described territory towit beginning at a point located 46 30 west a distance of 92800 feet from the point of intersection of the center of cherry street and the center of the main line track of the atlantic coast line railroad in said city  thence north 43 30 east a distance of 92800 feet  thence south 46 30 east a distance of 18560 feet  thence south 43 30 west a distance of 235600 feet  thence north 46 30 west a distance of 185600 feet  thence north 43 30 east a distance of 14280 feet to the point of beginning the boundaries of this city at all times shall be shown on a map a written description or any combination thereof to be retained permanently in the office of the city clerk and to be designated as the case may be official map or description of the corporate limits of the city of jesup georgia photographic typed or other copies of such map or description certified by the city clerk shall be admitted as evidence in all courts and shall have the same force and effect as the original map or description the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup may provide for the redrawing of any such map by ordinance to reflect lawful changes in the corporate boundaries a redrawn map shall supersede for all purposes the entire map or maps which it is designated to replace  14  powers generally all powers functions rights privileges and immunities of the city of jesup its officers agencies or employees as exist from timetotime under general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia or the acts of the georgia general assembly or the constitution of the state of georgia shall be carried into execution as provided by this charter the powers of the city of jesup shall be construed liberally in favor of the city of jesup and shall include all powers under the general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia the acts of the georgia general assembly the constitution of the state of georgia or under this charter the specific mention or failure to mention particular powers shall not be construed as limiting in any way the powers of the city of jesup if this charter makes no provision such shall be carried into execution as provided by ordinance or as provided by pertinent laws of the general assembly of the state of georgia at all times during its perpetual existence the city of jesup shall exercise enjoy and be entitled to the powers rights and privileges set forth in this charter and as otherwise exist under the general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia the acts of the georgia general assembly or the constitution of the state of georgia  15  powers illustrated without limiting the foregoing the city of jesup shall also have the following additional powers functions rights privileges and immunities  alcohol regulations to regulate the sale possession distribution consumption manufacture transportation and taxation of alcoholic beverages wine spirits liquors cider and related beverages and products  to provide for the issuance of licenses for the sale possession distribution consumption manufacture transportation and taxation of alcoholic beverages or products and the establishment of standards related to such licenses  to provide for zoning land use and related restrictions on real property and land related to property and premises involved in the sale possession distribution consumption manufacture transportation and taxation of alcoholic beverages or products  animal regulations to regulate and license or to prohibit the keeping harboring maintenance or running atlarge of animals fishes and fowl and to provide for the impoundment of the same if in violation of any ordinance or lawful order  to provide for the disposition by sale gift or humane destruction of animals fishes and fowl when not redeemed as provided by ordinance  and to provide punishment for violation of ordinances enacted hereunder  appropriations and expenditures to make appropriations for the support of the government of the city of jesup  to authorize the expenditure of money for any purpose authorized by this charter and for any purpose for which a municipality is authorized by the laws of the state of georgia  and to provide for the payment of expenses of the city of jesup  building regulation to regulate and to license the erection and construction of buildings and all other structures within the city of jesup  to adopt building housing plumbing electrical gas fire lifesafety propertymaintenance and heating and air conditioning codes  and to regulate all housing and building trades to the extent permitted under the general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia the acts of the georgia general assembly or the constitution of the state of georgia  business regulation and taxation to levy and to provide for the collection of regulatory fees and taxes on privileges occupations trades businesses and professions as authorized by title 48 of the official georgia annotated or such other applicable laws as are or may hereafter be enacted by the georgia general assembly  to permit and regulate the same  to provide for the manner and method of payment of such regulatory fees and taxes  to revoke such permits  and to generally regulate trade business occupations and professions within the geographical and jurisdictional limits of the city of jesup  cemeteries to provide for the creation construction and maintenance of a cemetery or cemeteries for the interment of human remains  codification of ordinances to codify all ordinances of the city of jesup together with this charter into one book to be known as the the city of jesup  commercial development to provide for standards rules regulations and incentives as permitted by general laws of statewide application for the development of trade business commerce employment opportunities and real property improvement  condemnation 1 power to condemn property for present or future use and for any public purpose deemed necessary by the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup utilizing procedures enumerated in title 22 of the official georgia annotated or such other applicable laws of the state of georgia as are or may hereafter be enacted  and 2 removal and remediation to remove replace and cause to be remediated or removed any building structure or existing condition upon real property and land within the city of jesups corporate limits that is or are dangerous to life limb persons or property by reasons of decay dilapidation or unsanitary or dangerous conditions nothing in this subparagraph shall be construed to relieve the city of jesup of any duty to provide owners or interested persons reasonable notice and opportunity to remedy an underlying condition necessitating removal and remediation this subparagraph shall not be construed as authorizing the doing of any act or thing contrary to the constitution of the state of georgia or the laws of the state of georgia the city of jesup shall have authority to adopt reasonable ordinances and resolutions for the purpose of carrying out this subparagraph  construction building and property maintenance standards to provide for minimum standards regulations rules and regulations related to construction improvement remodeling repair building erection and maintenance of buildings houses structures and improvements on real property and land  contracts to enter into contracts and agreements with other governmental entities and with private persons associations of persons firms partnerships corporations limited liability companies organizations joint ventures or other parties  emergencies to establish procedures for determining and proclaiming that an emergency exists within or without the city of jesup and to make and carry out all reasonable provisions deemed necessary to address or meet such emergencies for the protection safety health or the wellbeing of the public at large  environmental protection to protect and preserve the natural resources physical and aesthetic environment and vital geographic geologic hydrologic and historicallysignificant areas of the city of jesup the region and the state of georgia enactment of ordinances that preserve and improve air quality restore and maintain water resources control erosion and sedimentation manage stormwater and establish a stormwater utility manage solid and hazardous waste provide for disposal of solid waste and inert materials and provide other necessary or beneficial actions for the protection of the environment  ethics to adopt ethics ordinances and regulations governing such matters including but not limited to the conduct of elected municipal officials appointed officials contractors vendors and employees  establishing procedures for ethics complaints  and setting forth penalties for violations of such rules and procedures  fire and public safety regulations to fix and establish firesafety lifesafety building and construction and publicsafety codes rules prohibitions regulations limitations and restrictions and from time to time to extend enlarge or restrict the same  to prescribe firesafety lifesafety building and construction and publicsafety codes rules prohibitions regulations limitations and restrictions not inconsistent with general laws of statewide application relating to fire prevention and detection public safety crime prevention firefighting and other matters generally affecting public health safety and welfare  and to prescribe penalties and punishment for violations thereof  and similar regulations for the overall promotion and preservation of public health safety and welfare  food preparation and delivery to provide for codes rules prohibitions regulations limitations and restrictions related to the preparation manufacture distribution dissemination or handling of food or other products intended for human consumption and the premises or structures or vehicles and equipment utilized in such activities  garbage services and fees to provide for the collection accumulation storage and disposal of garbage waste trash refuse and similar items  and to levy fix assess and collect garbage refuse trash collection and disposal and other sanitary service charge taxes or fees  to enforce the payment of such charges taxes or fees  and to provide for the manner and method of collecting such service charges taxes or fees  general health safety and welfare to define regulate and prohibit any act practice conduct or use of property which is detrimental to the health sanitation cleanliness welfare and safety of the general public and the city of jesup and its inhabitants citizens businesses and visitors  to provide for the enforcement of such standards  and to provide for the proper maintenance and disposal of wastes and debris  gifts to accept or refuse gifts donations bequests or grants from any source for any purpose legally permitted under the general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia and the georgia constitution and including on such terms and conditions as the donor or grantor may impose  health and sanitation to prescribe standards of health cleanliness and sanitation and to provide for the enforcement of such standards  homestead exemption to establish and maintain procedures for offering homestead exemptions to residents of the city of jesup and maintaining current homestead exemptions of residents of the city of jesup as authorized under the laws of the state of georgia and the georgia constitution  inquiries and investigations to make inquiries and investigations into the affairs of the city of jesup and conduct of any department office or agency thereof and for this purpose may subpoena witnesses administer oaths take testimony and require the production of evidence any person who fails or refuses to obey a lawful order issued in the exercise of these powers by the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup shall be punished as may be provided by applicable ordinances or applicable laws of the state of georgia  jail sentences to provide that persons given jail sentences in the city of jesups municipal court may work out such sentences in any public works or on the streets roads drains and other public property in the city of jesup  to provide for commitment of such persons to any jail  to provide for the use of pretrial diversion and any alternative sentencing allowed by under the laws of the state of georgia and the georgia constitution  or to provide for commitment of such persons to any county work camp or county jail  motor vehicles to regulate the operation of motor vehicles and pedestrian traffic and to exercise control over all traffic of any form including parking in upon across or over the highways thoroughfares streets roads alleys lanes sidewalks and walkways of the city of jesup  to provide for the orderly operation of vehicles and equipment within the city of jesup  and to provide for the safe efficient and orderly control of traffic in upon across or over the highways thoroughfares streets roads alleys lanes sidewalks and walkways of the city of jesup  municipal agencies and delegation of power to create alter or abolish departments boards agencies authorities departments boards agencies authorities and offices of the city of jesup and to confer upon such departments boards agencies authorities and offices the necessary and appropriate authorities powers rights and entitlements to effectuate their respective purposes  municipal courts to create a municipal court with a judge or judges and associate judges as may be necessary and to authorize the creation of a municipal court clerks office or similar office as appointed by the mayor and board of commissioners the clerk of the city of jesup may be authorized to perform such duties if appointed and may occupy such role the board of commissioners and the city of jesup though having the power and authority to do so is under no obligation to create a municipal court clerk or similar office and is likewise not under obligation to have the city clerk perform such duties  municipal debts to incur debts obligations encumbrances liabilities and commitments as authorized by this charter the laws of the state of georgia and the georgia constitution  to both appropriate and borrow money for the payment of such debts obligations encumbrances liabilities and commitments of the city of jesup  to pledge the credit of the city of jesup as authorized by this charter the laws of the state of georgia and the georgia constitution  and to issue bonds mortgages indentures and other security instruments as authorized by this charter the laws of the state of georgia and the georgia constitution  municipal property ownership to acquire dispose of lease and hold in trust or otherwise any real personal or mixed property in fee simple or lesser interest inside or outside of the geographical limitations of the city of jesup  municipal property protection to provide for the preservation and protection of all property and equipment of the city of jesup and the administration and use of same by the public and to prescribe penalties and punishment for violations thereof  municipal utilities to acquire lease construct operate maintain sell and dispose of public utilities including but not limited to a system of waterworks water pumping plants and accessories wells cisterns towers water mains piping sewers and drains sewage disposal stormwater management gas works electricity generating plants cable television and other telecommunications transportation facilities public airports and any other public utility  to fix the taxes charges rates fares fees assessments regulations and penalties for all such public utilities  and to provide for the withdrawal of service for refusal or failure to pay the same  nuisance to define a nuisance and provide for its abatement whether on public or private property  penalties to provide penalties for violation of any ordinances adopted pursuant to the authority of this charter and the laws of the state of georgia  planning and zoning to provide for comprehensive city planning to pass and adopt ordinances rules and regulations for land use zoning restrictions on the use of real property and regulations for the development and maintenance of real property signage buildings structures and outside advertising  and to provide subdivision regulation all to ensure a safe healthy and aesthetically pleasing community  police and fire protection to exercise the power of arrest enforcement and authorized officers and to establish operate or contract for police and firefighting agencies  public hazards removal to provide for the destruction and removal of any building or other structure or physical condition which is or may become dangerous unsanitary or detrimental to the public health welfare or interest  public improvements to provide for the acquisition construction building operation maintenance or abolition of water and sewer systems highways and streets alleys lanes thoroughfares and roads public ways parks and playgrounds recreational facilities cemeteries public buildings libraries public housing parking facilities and charitable cultural educational recreational conservation sport detention penal and medical institutions agencies and any facilities or improvements necessary to promote and protect the public health wellbeing and safety of the citizens of and visitors to the city of jesup  to provide any other public improvements and to regulate the use of public improvements for such purposes property may be acquired by condemnation under title 22 of the official georgia annotated or such other applicable laws as are or may hereafter be enacted  public peace to provide for the prevention and punishment of loitering disorderly conduct drunkenness riots and public disturbances  public transportation to organize and operate or to participate in the operation of such public transportation systems as are deemed beneficial by the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup to the extent permitted by federal and state law the mayor and board of commissioners may provide by ordinance for the regulation of buses trains trolleys streetcars or other forms of public transportation operating in or traveling city of jesup  public utilities and services to grant franchises or make contracts for or impose taxes on public utilities and public service companies  and to regulations of the georgia public service commission or its successor  purchasing to make purchases of or to otherwise lawfully acquire goods services equipment vehicles and supplies  regulation of roadside areas to prohibit or regulate and control the erection removal and maintenance of signs billboards trees shrubs fences buildings and any and all other structures or obstructions upon or adjacent to the rights of way of streets and roads or within view thereof within or abutting the geographic limitations and boundaries of the city of jesup  and to prescribe penalties and punishment for violation of such ordinances  remedy unsafe and unsanitary conditions to remediate remove or cause or order to be remediated or removed any building structure or existing condition within the city of jesups corporate limits that is dangerous to life limb persons or property by reasons of decay dilapidation or unsanitary or dangerous conditions pursuant to the city of jesups power to regulate the health safety and welfare of its citizens  retirement and employee benefits to provide and maintain a retirement plan insurance and such other employee benefits for appointed officers and employees of the city of jesup as may be determined from timetotime by the mayor and board of commissioners  roadways to build construct design lay out open extend widen narrow establish or change the grade of abandon or close construct pave curb gutter adorn with shade trees or otherwise improve maintain repair clean prevent erosion of and light the highways thoroughfares roads streets alleys lanes sidewalks and walkways within the geographic limitations and boundaries of the city of jesup  to grant franchises and rights of way throughout those streets and roads and over the bridges and viaducts for the use of public utilities  and to require real estate owners to repair and maintain in a safe condition the sidewalks adjoining their lots or lands and to impose penalties for failure to do so  sewer fees to levy a fee charge or tax as necessary to assure the acquiring constructing equipping operating maintaining and extending of a sewage disposal plant and sewerage system and to levy on those to whom sewers and sewerage systems are made available a sewer service fee charge or sewer tax for the availability or use of the sewers  to provide for the manner and method of collecting such service charges and for enforcing payment of the same  and to charge impose and collect a connection fee or fees to those connected with the system  solid waste disposal to provide for the collection and disposal of garbage rubbish and refuse and to regulate the collection and disposal of garbage rubbish and refuse by others  and to provide for the separate collection of glass tin aluminum cardboard paper and other recyclable materials and to provide for the sale of such items refuse or their byproducts when feasible to do so  special assessments to levy and provide for the collection of special assessments for any public improvements as may be permitted by this charter the general laws of the state of georgia and georgia constitution  special areas of public regulation to regulate or prohibit junk dealers and the manufacture and sale of intoxicating liquors  to regulate the transportation storage and use of combustible explosive and inflammable materials the use of lighting and heating equipment and any other business or situation which may be dangerous to persons or property  to regulate and control the conduct of peddlers and itinerant traders theatrical performances exhibitions and shows of any kind by taxation or otherwise  to license and tax professional fortunetelling palmistry and massage parlors  and to restrict adult novelty and bookstores to certain areas  taxes  ad valorem to levy and provide for the assessment valuation revaluation and collection of taxes on all property subject to taxation all such valuations will be performed in accordance with general laws of statewide application  taxes  other to levy and collect such other taxes and fees as may be allowed now or in the future by law  taxes to impose pass enforce and collect and taxes or fees that are permitted by law  taxes on insurance premiums the mayor and board of commissioners are hereby empowered and authorized to assess levy and collect a tax on fire life casualty and accident insurance premiums which are collected from policy holders residing in said city or when any policy holder resides out of the city of jesup but the property insured is located in said city and said tax may be in addition to any other license tax or fee the said city may be authorized to collect from insurance companies or their agents doing business in said city  taxicabs to regulate and license vehicles operated for hire in the city of jesup  to limit the number of such vehicles  to require the operators thereof to be licensed  to require public liability insurance on such vehicles in the amounts to be prescribed by ordinance  to inspect such vehicles and mandate standards of safety and cleanliness  and to regulate the parking of such vehicles  tourism conventions and trade shows to authorize the city of jesup to contract with private sector nonprofit organizations or other governmental agencies to promote tourism conventions and trade shows  urban redevelopment to organize and operate an urban redevelopment program  water fees to levy a fee charge or tax as necessary to assure the acquiring constructing equipping operating maintaining and extending of a water treatment plant and water system and to levy on those to whom water and water systems are made available a water service fee charge or water tax for the availability or use of the water  to provide for the manner and method of collecting such service charges and for enforcing payment of the same  and to charge impose and collect a connection fee or fees to those connected with the system  other powers to exercise and enjoy all other powers functions rights privileges and immunities necessary or desirable to promote or protect the safety health peace security good order comfort convenience or general welfare of the city of jesup and its inhabitants  to exercise all implied powers necessary or desirable to carry into execution all powers granted in this charter as fully and completely as if such powers were fully stated herein  and to exercise all powers now or in the future authorized to be exercised by other municipal governments under other laws of the state of georgia  and any listing of particular powers in this charter shall not be held to be exclusive of others or restrictive of general words and phrases granting powers but shall be held to be in addition to such powers unless expressly prohibited to municipalities under the constitution or applicable laws of the state of georgia  article 2  government structure 21  administration the legislative authority of the government of the city of jesup georgia except as otherwise specifically provided in this charter shall be vested in the dulyelected commissioners of the city of jesup or appointed as is otherwise permitted in this charter and its dulyelected mayor or again appointed as is otherwise permitted in this charter the board of commissioners and mayor shall be elected in the manner provided by this charter and as otherwise mandated by the georgia constitution and general laws of statewide application or appointed in the event of the occurrence of a vacancy in the office of commissioner or mayor as otherwise set forth herein  22  commissioner districts  election by district in addition to any other requirements or qualifications imposed by or existing under the georgia constitution and general laws of statewide application no person shall be eligible to serve as commissioner of the city of jesup georgia unless such person a shall have been a resident of the city of jesup for the twelve 12 months immediately prior to the date of election for that districts commissioner and b a resident of the district for which such person intends to qualify for election for the twelve 12 months immediately prior to the date of election for that districts commissioner and c is registered and qualified to vote in municipal elections of the city of jesup the six 6
