census blocks the 2010 us census blocks shall control  23  elections by city  district  majority vote in mayoral election  runoffs the mayor shall be elected by a majority vote of the eligible voters of the city of jesup at large voting at the elections of the city of jesup in the event that no candidate for mayor obtains a majority vote of the eligible voters of the city of jesup at large voting at the elections of the city of jesup then a runoff election shall be held the candidates receiving the two highest numbers of votes in the election shall be included in the runoff election and the candidate receiving the highest number of votes in the runoff of the qualified electors of the city of jesup at large voting in such runoff shall be elected each candidate for mayor shall reside in the city of jesup as required under this charter  majority vote in commissioner elections  runoffs the commissioners shall be elected by a majority vote of the eligible voters of the respective council districts voting at the elections of the city of jesup in the event that no candidate for a council post obtains a majority vote of the eligible voters of the council district voting in the election then a runoff election shall be held the candidates receiving the two highest numbers of votes in the election for such council post shall be included in the runoff election the person receiving the highest number of votes of the eligible voters of the council district voting at such runoff election shall be elected each candidate for election to commissioner shall at all times reside in the district which he or she seeks to represent as required by this charter likewise each commissioner shall remain a resident of his or her district for as long as he or she holds the office of commissioners for each district  24  qualifications for office  notice of intent to seek office each candidate for the offices of the mayor or commissioner for the city of jesup shall file a notice of candidacy in accordance with applicable laws of statewide application or ordinance with the city clerk of the city of jesup or his or her designee  commissioners in addition to any other requirements or qualifications imposed by or existing under the georgia constitution and general laws of statewide application no person shall be eligible to serve as commissioner of the city of jesup georgia unless such person a shall have been a resident of the city of jesup for the twelve 12 months immediately prior to the date of election for that districts commissioner and b a resident of the district for which such person intends to qualify for election for the twelve 12 months immediately prior to the date of election for the districts commissioner and c is registered and qualified to vote in municipal elections of the city of jesup each commissioner shall continue to reside both in the city of jesup and the district for which such person was elected as commissioner during that persons period of service as a commissioner and such person shall continue to be registered and qualified to vote in municipal elections of the city of jesup each person desiring to offer as a candidate for commissioner shall designate the district for which he or she is offering  mayor in addition to any other requirements or qualifications imposed by or existing under the georgia constitution and general laws of statewide application no person shall be eligible to serve as mayor of the city of jesup georgia unless such person a shall have been a resident of the city of jesup for the twelve 12 months immediately prior to the date of election for mayor and b is registered and qualified to vote in municipal elections of the city of jesup the mayor shall continue to reside in the city of jesup during that persons period of service as the mayor and to be registered and qualified to vote in municipal elections of the city of jesup each person desiring to offer as a candidate for mayor shall designate that he or she is qualifying for the position of mayor  mayor pro tempore in addition to any other requirements or qualifications imposed by or existing under the georgia constitution and general laws of statewide application and this charter no person shall be eligible to serve as mayor pro tempore of the city of jesup unless that person is a commissioner each commissioner shall successively serve as mayor pro tempore for a period of twelve 12 months the commissioners shall rotate by district beginning with district 1 and serving for successive twelve 12 month terms  other elective offices prohibited elected officials of the city of jesup shall not hold other elected public offices  vacancies the offices of mayor and commissioner shall become vacant upon the incumbents death resignation removal forfeiture of or disqualification for office  oath of offices the oaths of the offices of the mayor and board of commissioners shall to the extent that it is permitted under federal and state law be as follows i do solemnly swear or affirm that i will faithfully execute the office of commissioner or mayor as the case may be of the city of jesup and will to the best of my ability support and defend the constitution of the united states the constitution of the state of georgia and the charter ordinances and regulations of the city of jesup i am not the holder of any unaccounted for public money due this state or any political subdivision or authority thereof i am not the holder of any office of trust under the government of the united states any other state or any foreign state which i by the laws of the state of georgia am prohibited from holding i am otherwise qualified to hold said office according to the constitution and laws of georgia i have been a resident of the city of jesup for the time required by the constitution and laws of this state and by the charter of the city of jesup and in the event of the office of commissioner of my district for the time required by the constitution and laws of this state and by the charter of the city of jesup i will perform the duties of my office in the best interests of the city of jesup to the best of my ability without fear favor affection reward or expectation thereof  25  terms and compensation except in the case of their special election to fulfill the unexpired term of a vacancy in the offices of the mayor or a commissioner the mayor and each member of the board of commissioners shall serve for terms of four 4 years and until their respective successors are elected and qualified except in the case of their special election to fulfill the unexpired term of a vacancy in the offices of the mayor or a commissioner the terms of offices of the mayor and the commissioners generally shall begin on the first day in january immediately following the election of such mayor or commissioners unless the georgia constitution or general laws of statewide application requires the term to begin at the first organizational meeting in january or upon some other date the mayor and commissioners shall receive compensation and expenses for their services as provided by ordinance  26  conduct of elected and appointed officers  conflicts of interest  holding other offices  conduct elected and appointed officers of the city of jesup are trustees and servants of the residents of the city of jesup and shall act in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit of such residents  conflicts of interests generally no elected official appointed officer or employee of the city of jesup or any agency or political entity to which this charter applies shall knowingly perpetrate any of the following actions 1 business transactions engage in any business or transaction or have a financial or other personal interest direct or indirect which is incompatible with the proper discharge of that persons official duties or which would tend to impair the independence of the officials judgment or action in the performance of those official duties  2 voting vote upon any official matter coming before the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup in which such mayor or commissioner maintains a financial or other personal interest or where such officials judgment or action would be impaired  3 private employment engage in or accept private employment or render services for private interests when such employment or service is incompatible with the proper discharge of that persons official duties or would tend to impair the independence of the officials judgment or action in the performance of those official duties  4 confidential information disclose confidential information including information obtained at meetings which are closed pursuant to title 50 of the official georgia annotated concerning the property government or affairs of the governmental body by which the official is engaged without proper legal authorization  or use such information to advance the financial or other private interest of the official or others  5 gifts accept any valuable gift whether in the form of service loan thing or promise from any person firm or corporation which to the officials knowledge is interested directly or indirectly in any manner whatsoever in business dealings with the governmental body by which the official is engaged  provided however that an elected official who is a candidate for public office may accept campaign contributions and services in connection with any such campaign  6 adverse interest represent other private interests in any action or proceeding against this city of jesup or any portion of its government  or 7 financial interest vote or otherwise participate in the negotiation or in the making of any contract with any business or entity in which the official has a financial interest  disclosure any elected official appointed officer or employee who shall have any financial interest directly or indirectly in any contract or matter pending before or within any department of the city of jesup shall disclose such interest to the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup the mayor or any member of the board of commissioners who has a financial interest in any matter pending before the mayor and the board of commissioners shall disclose such interest and such disclosure shall be entered on the official records of the city of jesup and that official shall disqualify himself or herself from participating in any decision or vote relating thereto any elected official appointed officer or employee of any agency or political entity to which this charter applies who shall have any financial interest directly or indirectly in any contract or matter pending before or within such entity likewise shall disclose such interest to the governing body of such agency or entity  use of public property no elected official appointed officer or employee of the city of jesup or any agency or entity to which this charter applies shall use property owned by such governmental entity for personal benefit or profit but shall use such property only in their capacity as an officer or employee of the city of jesup  contracts voidable and rescindable any violation of this section which occurs with the knowledge express or implied of a party to a contract agreement purchase or sale shall render said contract agreement purchase or sale voidable at the option of the mayor and the board of commissioners  ineligibility of elected official except where authorized by law neither the mayor nor any member of the board of commissioners shall hold any other elective or appointive office in the city of jesup or otherwise be employed by said government or any agency thereof during the term for which that official was elected no former mayor or any former member of the board of commissioners shall hold any appointive office in the city until one 1 year after the expiration of the term for which that official was elected  political activities of certain officers and employees no appointive officer of the city of jesup shall continue in such employment upon qualifying as a candidate for nomination or election to any public office no employee of the city of jesup shall continue in such employment upon qualifying for or election to any public office of the city of jesup or any other public office which is inconsistent incompatible or in conflict with the duties of the city employee none of the mayor any member of the board of commissioners or any city employee may openly campaign for or against any candidate for public office or any public referendum in his or her official capacity as an elected official or public employee of the city of jesup or to lend his or her office or position as an employee to such campaign  penalties for violation 1 adjudication any violation under 6 shall be charged determined and adjudicated in accordance with of the city of jesup official ordinances as amended from time to time 2 forfeiture any mayor or commissioner of the city of jesup who is determined to have concealed a financial conflict of interest or knowingly violated any of the requirements of this shall be guilty of malfeasance in office or position and shall be deemed to have forfeited that persons office or position 3 ineligibility any mayor or commissioner of the city of jesup who shall forfeit an office or position as described in paragraph  above shall be ineligible for appointment or election to or employment in a position by the city of jesup for a period of three 3 years thereafter  article 3  administrative officers 31  city manager the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup shall appoint a city manager who shall neither be the mayor nor a commissioner the city manager shall be the chief administrative officer of the government of the city of jesup the city manager shall devote all of his or her full working time and attention to the affairs of the city and shall be responsible to the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup for the proper and efficient administration of the affairs of the city over which such officer has jurisdiction  32  city clerk the city clerk shall be custodian of the official city seal and city records  maintain the citys records as required by this charter or general laws of statewide application  attend all meetings of council  keep a careful and accurate record of the official proceedings of the mayor and board of commissioners including a record of the votes on all questions before the said mayor and board of commissioners  furnish to the mayor and board of commissioners or any of them such information as may be requested by any of them  keep and preserve all of the official records of the city of jesup  and perform such other duties as may be assigned the city clerk shall be appointed by the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup  33  city attorney the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup may in their discretion appoint a city attorney who shall represent the mayor and board of commissioners and whose duties shall include the drafting of such ordinances as may be required by the board of commissioners attend such meetings of the mayor and board of commissioners as may be required prosecute cases wherein violations of city ordinances are charged in the municipal court when requested by the mayor and board of commissioners to do so advise the mayor and board of commissioners on all questions of law wherein advice is requested and perform such other duties as may be required by the mayor and board of commissioners the mayor and board of commissioners shall not delegate the authority to appoint or fix the compensation of the city attorney to the city manager  34  chief of police the city manager shall appoint a chief of police  35  chief of the fire department the city manager shall appoint a chief of the fire department  36  treasurer the treasurer of the city of jesup shall receive account for and regularly disburse all moneys or property received by the city of jesup and perform all other duties devolving upon him or her as treasurer of the city of jesup the office of the treasurer may be held simultaneously by the same person holding the office of clerk of the city of jesup the treasurer shall maintain and keep an accurate set of books of accounts showing in detail all items of income and expense of the city  present to the mayor and board of commissioners a detailed statement of the financial conditions of the city  and collect and account for all revenues due to the city from whatever source when the office of clerk of the city of jesup and treasurer of the city of jesup shall be held by the same person all duties of the clerk shall be performed by such person as clerk city of jesup and all duties as treasurer shall be performed as treasurer city of jesup the treasurer shall be appointed by the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup  37  removal all officers and directors that are specifically appointed by the board of commissioners shall be employees at will and subject to removal or suspension at any time by the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup unless otherwise provided by law or ordinance  article 4  elections  vacancies 41  conduct of nonpartisan elections political parties shall not conduct primaries for offices of the mayor and each of the commissioners and all names of candidates for offices of the mayor and each of the commissioners shall be listed without party designations  42  vacancies in office  vacancies in the office of the mayor 1 permanent vacancy the office of mayor shall become permanently vacant upon the incumbents death resignation forfeiture of office or removal from office in any manner authorized by this charter or general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia a vacancy in the office of mayor shall be filled for the remainder of the unexpired term by a special election if such vacancy occurs twelve 12 months or more prior to the expiration of the term of that office if such vacancy occurs within twelve 12 months of the expiration of the term of that office the mayor and the commissioners of the city of jesup or those members remaining may appoint a successor for the remainder of the term for purposes of this section twelve 12 months shall be synonymous with threehundred and sixtyfive 365 days 2 temporary vacancy the office of the mayor shall become temporarily vacant upon the incumbents suspension from office of the mayor or when the mayor from a bona fide sickness or other such unavailability is unable to act in the event of a temporary vacancy the mayor pro tempore shall be appointed in accordance with the provisions outlined in   of this charter the mayor pro tempore shall serve for a term of twelve 12 months or until the next general election whichever length of time is shortest the mayor pro tempore shall be clothed with all the rights and privileges of the mayor and shall perform the duties of the office of the mayor so long as such suspension sickness or other unavailability shall continue upon the discontinuation of the suspension sickness or other unavailability of the mayor as determined by a majority vote of the board of commissioners not serving as mayor pro tempore the mayor pro tempore shall no longer be clothed with the rights and privileges of the mayor shall cease to perform the duties of the office of the mayor and shall no longer be mayor pro tempore  vacancies in the office of commissioner the office of a commissioner shall become vacant upon the incumbents death resignation forfeiture of office or removal from office in any manner authorized by this charter or the general laws of statewide application a vacancy in the office of a commissioner shall be filled for the remainder of the unexpired term by a special election in accordance with titles 21 and 41 of the official georgia annotated if such vacancy occurs twelve 12 months or more prior to the expiration of the term of that office if such vacancy occurs within twelve 12 months of the expiration of the term of that office the mayor and remaining commissioners shall appoint a successor for the remainder of the term of the vacated office of commissioner this provision shall also apply to a temporary vacancy created by the suspension from office of a commissioner or created by a commissioners inability to fulfill his or her official duties for purposes of this section twelve 12 months shall be synonymous with onehundred and fortyfour 144 days  43  eligible voters the registration of eligible voters of the city of jesup shall be integrated with the system of permanent registration of voters established by the official georgia annotated no voter even if otherwise qualified shall be permitted to vote at any election within the municipality unless he or she is duly registered under the provisions of general law of statewide application  44  administration of elections all elections shall be held at such polling locations as set by the board of commissioners and the mayor by ordinance and conducted in accordance with of title 21 of the official georgia annotated the georgia election  as now or hereafter amended or otherwise provided by law except as otherwise provided by this charter the mayor and board of commissioners may by ordinance or resolution prescribe such rules and regulations as it deems appropriate to fulfill duties imposed under of title 21 of the official georgia annotated the georgia election  as now or hereafter amended or otherwise provided by law the mayor and board of commissioners may appoint such office or superintendent of elections as permitted by law  45  restrictions on influencing elections neither the city manager nor any employee of the city of jesup in their official capacity shall campaign for solicit take any part in securing or contribute any work efforts or money towards the nomination or election of any candidate for the office of commissioner or mayor for the city of jesup except to answer such direct questions as may be asked of him or her and which he or she desires to answer  article 5  meetings 51  regular and special meetings  regular the mayor and board of commissioners shall hold regular meetings at such times and places as shall be prescribed by ordinance of the mayor and board of commissioners but in no event not less than one 1 time per gregorian calendar month unless prohibited from doing so by emergency  special special meetings of mayor and board of commissioners may be held on call of the board of commissioners of the city of jesup as shall be prescribed by ordinance of the city of jesup  notice all meetings of the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup shall be public to the extent required by law and notice to the public of special meetings shall be made fully as is reasonably possible as provided by of the official georgia annotated or other such applicable laws as are or may hereafter be enacted  rules the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup shall adopt its rules of procedure and order of business consistent with the provisions of this charter and shall provide for keeping of a journal of the official proceedings and actions of the city of jesup and the said mayor and board of commissioners which shall be a public record  52  voting  quorum required four 4 commissioners shall constitute a quorum and shall be authorized to transact business of the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup georgia in the absence of a quorum the presiding officer shall at the instance of any member compel the attendance of absent members  provided however the enactment of any ordinance or resolution or the passage of any motion or the transaction of any business requiring a vote of the board shall require at least four votes of the board in instances where at least four 4 votes are not cast the abstention rules as outlined in  shall not apply voting on the adoption of ordinances or the resolution upon official action shall be by voice vote and the vote shall be recorded in the journal or other official records of the city of jesup georgia  roll call vote any commissioner shall have the right to request a roll call vote and such vote shall be recorded in the journal  majority vote required except as otherwise provided in this charter the affirmative vote of the majority of the members of the board of commissioners excluding the mayor voting upon any matter before them shall be required for the adoption of any ordinance resolution motion or other official action of the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup or in those instances where it shall be necessary for the mayor to vote in the event of a tie in the vote of the commissioners the affirmative vote of the majority of the mayor and board of commissioners shall be required for the adoption of any ordinance resolution motion or other official action of the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup  no abstentions no commissioner who is otherwise eligible to vote shall abstain from voting on any matter properly brought before the council for official action except when such commissioner has a conflict of interest as set forth in which is disclosed in writing prior to or at the meeting and made a part of the minutes any commissioner or the mayor in the event of a tie in the votes of the commissioners when otherwise present and eligible to vote on a matter but refusing to do so for any reason other than a properly disclosed and recorded conflict of interest shall be deemed to have voted in the affirmative  article 6  budget 61  budget fiscal and accounting year the fiscal budget and accounting year of the city shall begin on the first day of july and end on the last day of june of each year  62  preparation and budgets the mayor and the board of commissioners shall provide an ordinance on the procedures and requirements for the preparation and execution of an annual operating budget a capital improvement plan and a capital budget including requirements as to the scope content and form of such budgets and plans  63  submission of operating and capital budget to mayor and the board of commissioners on or before a date fixed by the mayor and the board of commissioners but not later than ninety 90 days prior to the beginning of each fiscal year the city manager shall submit to the mayor and the commissioners a proposed operating and capital budget for the ensuing fiscal year the budget shall be accompanied by a message from the city manager containing the important features of the budget explanations of major changes recommended for the next fiscal year a general summary of the budget and such other pertinent comments and information as may be requested by the mayor and the commissioners the operating budget and the capital budget hereinafter provided for the budget message and all supporting documents shall be filed in the office of the city clerk and shall be open to public inspection  64  action by mayor and the board of commissioners on budget  amendments the mayor and the board of commissioners may amend the operating budget proposed by the city manager  except that the budget as finally amended and adopted must provide for all expenditures required by state law or by other provisions of this charter and for all debt service requirements for the ensuing fiscal year  final adoption of operating and capital budgets the mayor and the board of commissioners by ordinance shall adopt the final operating budget and capital budget for the ensuing fiscal year not later than june 30 of each calendar year if the mayor and the board of commissioners fail to adopt the operating budget by this date the amounts appropriated for operation for the immediatelyprior fiscal year shall be deemed adopted for the following month expiring on july 31 adoption of the operating budget and capital budget shall take the form of an appropriations ordinance setting out the estimated revenues and making appropriations according to fund and by organizational unit purpose or activity  no exceeding appropriation unless the budget is otherwise amended as permitted in this charter the amount set out in the adopted operating budget for each organizational unit shall constitute the annual appropriation for such and no expenditure shall be made or encumbrance created in excess of the otherwise unencumbered balance of the appropriations or allotment thereof to which it is chargeable  changes in appropriations the mayor and the board of commissioners in accordance with general law of statewide application and this charter by ordinance may make changes in the appropriations contained in the current operating budget at any regular meeting special or emergency meeting called for such purpose  independent audit there shall be an annual independent audit of all city accounts funds and financial transactions by a certified public accountant selected by the mayor and the board of commissioners the audit shall be conducted according to generally accepted auditing principles any audit of any funds by the state or federal governments may be accepted as satisfying the requirements of this charter copies of annual audit reports shall be available at printing costs to the public  article 7  finance 71  property taxes the mayor and the board of commissioners may assess levy and collect an ad valorem tax on all real and personal property within the corporate limits of the city that is otherwise subject to such taxation by the state of georgia and county of wayne this tax is for the purpose of raising revenues to defray the costs of operating the city government of providing governmental services for the repayment of principal and interest on general obligations and for any other public purpose as determined by the mayor and the board of commissioners in their discretion  72  tax levies the mayor and the board of commissioners shall levy by ordinance such taxes as are necessary or conducive to the efficient and orderly operation of the city the taxes and tax rates set by such ordinances shall be such that reasonable estimates of revenues from such levy shall at least be sufficient together with other anticipated revenues fund balances and applicable reserves to equal the total amount appropriated for each of the several funds set forth in the annual operating budget for defraying the expenses of the general government of the city of jesup  73  millage rate  due dates  payment methods the mayor and the board of commissioners by ordinance shall establish a millage rate for the city property tax a due date and the time period within which these taxes must be paid the mayor and the board of commissioners by ordinance may provide for the payment of these taxes by two installments or in one lump sum and further authorize the voluntary payment of taxes prior to the time when due any and all appeals related to this shall be brought in accordance with general laws of statewide application  74  report of tax rate at the first regular meeting of the mayor and the board of commissioners after july 15 of each year or as soon as is reasonably practicable following adoption of the budget ordinance set forth in the city manager shall report in writing to the mayor and the board of commissioners the estimated rate of tax levy required to produce an amount of income which together with the estimated income from all other sources will equal the appropriation made by the mayor and the board of commissioners and the mayor and the board of commissioners shall by ordinance at that time levy taxes at the rate specified in such report unless by an amendment of the appropriation ordinance reducing the appropriations the levy of a lower rate may be made possible but no such amendment shall reduce the appropriation made to pay the then existing city debt  75  occupation taxes and regulatory fees  occupation and business taxes the mayor and the board of commissioners by ordinance shall have the power to levy such occupation or business taxes as are not denied by law the mayor and the board of commissioners may classify businesses occupations or professions for the purpose of such taxation in any way which may be lawful and may compel the payment of such taxes as provided in this charter  regulatory fees  permits the mayor and the board of commissioners by ordinance shall have the power to require businesses or practitioners doing business or carrying on commerce within this city to obtain a permit for such activity from the city and pay a reasonable regulatory fee for such permit as provided by general law such fees may include the total cost to the city of regulating the activity and if unpaid shall be collected as provided in this charter  76  franchises  generally the mayor and the board of commissioners shall have the power to grant franchises for the use of this citys streets and alleys for the purposes of street railways telephone companies electric companies electric membership corporations cable television and other telecommunications companies cellular communications companies gas companies transportation companies and other similar organizations the mayor and the board of commissioners shall determine the duration terms whether the same shall be exclusive or nonexclusive and the consideration for such franchises  provided however no franchise shall be granted for a period in excess of 35 years and no franchise shall be granted unless the city receives just and adequate compensation therefor the mayor and the board of commissioners shall provide for the registration of all franchises with the city clerk in a registration book kept by the clerk the mayor and the board of commissioners may provide by ordinance for the registration within a reasonable time of all franchises previously granted  taxation if no franchise agreement is in effect the mayor and the board of commissioners shall have the authority to impose a tax on gross receipts for the use of the citys streets and alleys for the purposes of railroads street railways telephone companies electric companies electric membership corporations cable television and other telecommunications companies gas companies transportation companies and other similar organizations  77  service charges the mayor and the board of commissioners by ordinance shall have the power to assess and collect fees charges assessments and tolls for water sewers sanitary and health services or any other services or facilities provided or made available within and without the corporate limits of the city if unpaid such charges shall be collected as provided in this charter  78  special assessments the mayor and the board of commissioners shall have the power to assess and collect the cost of constructing repairing reconstructing paving repaving widening or improving any public way street alley lane sidewalk curbing gutters sewers drains ditches piping conduit or other utility mains and appurtenances from the abutting property owners if unpaid such charges shall be collected as provided in this charter the amount of such assessments on each parcel of real estate after having been made as herein provided shall be a lien on said real estate from the date of the passage of the ordinance providing for the work and making the assessment such liens shall have rank and priority of payment next in point of dignity to liens for city taxes and other liens which by law would have priority  and said city of jesup by and mayor and board of commissioners may transfer such fi fa in writing by authorizing by proper resolution the mayor to sign such transfer and the clerk to attest same the transferee or transferees shall have all of the rights under such fi fa as were had by said city  79  construction  other taxes and fees this city shall be empowered to levy any other tax or fee allowed now or hereafter by law and the specific mention of any right power or authority in this article shall not be construed as limiting in any way the general powers of this city to govern its local affairs  710  collection of delinquent taxes fees and assessments the city may collect delinquent taxes fees assessments or other revenue due the city under this charter by whatever reasonable means as are not precluded by law this shall include providing for the dates when the taxes fees or assessments are due  late penalties or interest  issuance execution and levies of fieiri facias  the sale or other disposition of public property at public outcry in the method in which public sales are conducted for property subject to such fieri facias  creation and priority of liens  making delinquent taxes fees or assessments personal debts of the persons required to pay the taxes fees or assessments imposed  revoking city permits for failure to pay any city taxes fees or assessments  and providing for the assignment or transfer of tax executions  711  general obligation bonds the mayor and the board of commissioners shall have the power to issue bonds for the purpose of raising revenue to carry out any project program or venture authorized under this charter or general laws of statewide application and further to contract debt on behalf of and issue bonds of said city as the valid obligations of said city under and in accordance with the laws and limitations provided in the constitution and general laws of statewide application of the state of georgia providing for bonded indebtedness of municipalities for the purpose of refunding valid and existing debts and bonded obligations of said city and any other purpose permitted by law such bonding authority shall be exercised in accordance with the laws governing bond issuance by municipalities in effect at the time said issue is undertaken  712  revenue bonds revenue bonds may be issued by the mayor and the board of commissioners as state law now or hereafter provides such bonds are to be paid out of any revenue produced by the project program or venture for which they were issued  713  shortterm loans the city may obtain shortterm loans as otherwise authorized by this charter and general laws of statewide application  714  long term loans and other similar obligations the city action of the mayor and the board of commissioners may enter into longterm loans and other obligations as otherwise authorized by laws of general statewide application  715  leasepurchase contracts the city action of the mayor and the board of commissioners may enter into multiyear lease purchase or lease purchase contracts for the acquisition of goods materials real and personal property services and supplies in accordance with this charter and general laws of statewide application  716  anticipation bonds and notes bonds and notes issued in anticipation of the collection of special assessments and bonds notes or registered warrants on the treasury issued in the anticipation of the collection of taxes may be authorized by the mayor and the board of commissioners by ordinance and shall not be deemed the creation of debt in the terms of bonded public indebtedness  717  how much  when the board of commissioners shall not later than the first regular meeting in december in each year pass and adopt a license tax ordinance providing for the collection of all special taxes licenses and income taxes as may be determined by the board of commissioners and all such taxes shall be and become due upon the first day of january in each year the board of commissioners may by ordinance designate the time within which all taxes shall be paid including authority to accept payment of taxes in installments upon such conditions as the board of commissioners may deem proper  718  revenue by any other legal means in addition to any of the foregoing revenue raising measures the mayor and the board of commissioners may raise revenue other legal means  article 8  expenditures 81  authority for expenditures all expenditures of the citys funds or dispositions of the citys property or equipment shall be made as provided by this charter or electronic transfer of funds either executed or approved by both the city manager and the treasurer and which is documented in writing or electronically in the event of the unavailability of either the city manager or the treasurer then the mayor may execute or approve such drafts or electronic transfers for the unavailable city manager or treasurer until the city manager or treasurer becomes available  82  purchasing and contracting procedures the mayor and the board of commissioners shall from time to time provide additional purchasing and contracting procedures that are consistent with the provisions of this charter  83  sale and lease of city property  transfers all real property and personal property of the city of jesup not needed for public use or that may have become unsuited for public use may be sold or disposed of as provided for by general laws of statewide application or in such manner as the mayor and board of commissioners may from time to time provide by ordinance if a method or procedure for disposal thereof is not otherwise mandated by a general law of statewide application  quitclaims the mayor and the board of commissioners may quitclaim any rights the city or they in their official capacities may have in property not needed for public purposes upon report by the city manager and adoption of a resolution both finding that the property is not needed for public or other purposes and that the interest of the city has no readily ascertainable monetary value  scrap lands whenever in opening extending or widening any street avenue alley or public place of the city a small parcel or tract of land is cutoff or separated by such work from a larger tract or boundary of land owned by the city the mayor and the board of commissioners may authorize the city manager to sell and convey said cutoff or separated parcel or tract of land to an abutting or adjoining property owner or owners where such sale and conveyance facilitates the enjoyment of the highest and best use of the abutting owners property included in the sales contract shall be a provision for the rightsofway of said street avenue alley or public place in the event that the mayor and the board of commissioners authorize to sell such parcel or tract then each abutting property owner shall be notified of the availability of the property and given the opportunity to purchase said property under such terms and conditions as set out by ordinance all deeds and conveyances heretofore and hereafter so executed and delivered shall convey all title and interest the city has in such property notwithstanding the fact that no public sale after advertisement was or is hereafter made  article 9  municipal court 91  municipal courtcreation  name there shall be a court to be known as the municipal court of the city of jesup  92  chief judge  associate judge the municipal court shall be presided over by a chief judge or such parttime fulltime or standby judges as shall be provided by ordinance  qualifications no person shall be qualified or eligible to serve as a judge on the municipal court unless that person shall have attained the age of 21 years shall be a member of the state bar of georgia and shall possess all qualifications required by law all judges shall be appointed by the mayor and the board of commissioners and shall serve until a successor is appointed and qualified  compensation the compensation of the judges shall be fixed by resolution of the mayor and board of commissioners  removal judges serve atwill and may be removed from office at any time by the mayor and the board of commissioners unless otherwise provided by ordinance  oath before assuming office each judge shall take an oath given by the mayor that the judge will honestly and faithfully discharge the duties of the office to the best of that persons ability and without fear favor or partiality  93  convening the municipal court shall be convened at regular intervals as provided by ordinance  94  jurisdiction  powers the municipal court shall have jurisdiction and authority to try and punish violations of this charter all city ordinances and such other violations as provided by law  95  contempt powers the municipal court shall have authority to punish those in its presence for contempt provided that such punishment shall not exceed two hundred dollars $20000 or ten 10 days in jail  96  fines and imprisonment the municipal court may fix punishment for offenses within its jurisdiction not exceeding a fine of 1000 dollars $100000 or imprisonment for onehundred and eighty 180 days or both such fine and imprisonment or may fix punishment by fine imprisonment or alternative sentencing as now or hereafter provided by law  97  reserved 98  fee schedule the municipal court shall have authority to establish a schedule of fees to defray the cost of operation and shall be entitled to reimbursement of the cost of meals transportation and caretaking of prisoners bound over to superior courts for violations of state law  99  bail the municipal court shall have authority to establish bail and recognizances to ensure the presence of those charged with violations before said court and shall have discretionary authority to accept cash or personal or real property as surety for the appearance of persons charged with violations whenever any person shall give bail for that persons appearance and shall fail to appear at the time fixed for trial the bond shall be forfeited by the judge presiding at such time and an execution issued thereon by serving the defendant and the defendants sureties with a rule nisi at least two 2 days before a hearing on the rule nisi in the event that cash or property is accepted in lieu of bond for security for the appearance of a defendant at trial and if such defendant fails to appear at the time and place fixed for trial the cash so deposited shall be on order of the judge declared forfeited to the city or the property so deposited shall have a lien against it for the value forfeited which lien shall be enforceable in the same manner and to the same extent as a lien for city property taxes  910  authority the municipal court shall have the same authority as superior courts to compel the production of evidence in the possession of any party  to enforce obedience to its orders judgments and sentences  and to administer such oaths as are necessary  911  power to compel the municipal court may compel the presence of all parties necessary to a proper disposal of each case by the issuance of summonses subpoenas and warrants which may be served as executed by any officer as authorized by this charter or by law  912  warrants each judge of the municipal court shall be authorized to issue warrants for the arrest of persons charged with offenses against any ordinance of the city and each judge of the municipal court shall have the same authority as a magistrate of the state to issue warrants for offenses against state laws committed within the city of jesup  913  certiorari the right of certiorari from the decision and judgment of the municipal court shall exist in all criminal cases and ordinance violation cases and such certiorari shall be obtained under the sanction of a judge of the superior court of county under the laws of the state of georgia regulating the granting and issuance of writs of certiorari  914  rules for court with the approval of the mayor and the board of commissioners the judge shall have full power and authority to make reasonable rules and regulations necessary and proper to secure the efficient and successful administration of the municipal court  provided however that the mayor and the board of commissioners may adopt in part or into the rules and regulations applicable to municipal courts the rules and regulations made or adopted shall be filed with the city clerk and shall be available for public inspection  article 10  miscellaneous 101  prior ordinances all ordinances resolutions rules and regulations now in force in the city of jesup and not inconsistent with this charter are hereby declared valid and of full effect and force until amended or repealed by the mayor and the board of commissioners of the city of jesup  102  bonds for officials the officers and employees of the city of jesup both elective and appointive shall execute such surety or fidelity bonds in such amounts and upon such terms and conditions as the board of commissioners and the mayor shall from time to time require by ordinance or as may be provided by law  103  pending matters except as specifically provided otherwise by this charter all rights claims actions orders contracts and legal or administrative proceedings shall continue and any such ongoing work or cases shall be completed by such city agencies personnel or offices as may be provided by the mayor and board of commissioners of the city of jesup  104  construction in this charter are informative only and are not to be considered as a part thereof the singular shall include the plural the masculine shall include the feminine and vice versa  105  severability if any article section subsection paragraph sentence or part thereof of this charter shall be held to be invalid or unconstitutional such invalidity or unconstitutionality shall not affect or impair other parts of this charter unless it clearly appears that such other parts are wholly and necessarily dependent upon the part held to be invalid or unconstitutional it being the legislative intent in enacting this charter that each article section subsection paragraph sentence or part thereof be enacted separately and independent of each other  106  repealer all previous charters of the city of jesup are repealed in their entirety and all amendatory acts thereto are likewise repealed in their entirety including any and all provisions from any and all previous charters that may not have been specifically addressed by this charter all other laws and parts of laws in conflict with this charter are hereby repealed  107  existing personnel and officers except as specifically provided otherwise by this charter all personnel and officers of the city of jesup and their rights privileges and powers shall continue beyond the time this charter takes effect until such time as the present mayor and board of commissioners shall pass a transition ordinance detailing any changes in personnel and appointive officers required or desired and arranging such titles rights privileges and powers as may be required or desired to allow a reasonable transition  108  effective date this charter shall become effective on   charter and related service ocga  45101 et seq regular meetings the board of commissioners of the city shall hold regular meetings on the first tuesday of each calendar month the hour fixed for any such regular meeting may be specially set by the board of commissioners by majority vote of the commissioners in the absence of any specially set hour for any such regular meeting or series of meetings regular meetings otherwise shall commence at seven oclock post meridian  pm when the day fixed for any such regular meeting falls on a day designated as a federal or state holiday such meeting shall be held on the next succeeding tuesday at the hour originally specially set for such meeting by majority vote of the board of commissioners or at seven oclock post meridian  pm if no such hour was specially set nothing contained herein shall otherwise prohibit restrict or prevent the board of commissioners of the city from calling holding convening or participating in any speciallycalled meeting or work session of the board of commissioners as otherwise permitted under the the city regular meetings of the board of commissioners of the city shall be held at city hall in jesup georgia the board of commissioners may however specially fix an alternative location for any such meeting by majority vote of the commissioners    special meetings a special meeting of the board of commissioners may be held at the call of any three commissioners whenever a special meeting is called notice shall be given by the clerk of the commissioners to each member of the board of commissioners setting forth the date hour and place of the meeting and the purpose for which the meeting is called and no business shall be transacted at such special meeting except such as is given in the notice without the unanimous consent of the entire board of commissioners  meeting agenda all reports communications ordinances resolutions contract documents or other matter to be submitted to the board of commissioners shall be delivered to the city manager at least 30 hours prior to each meeting of the board of commissioners whereupon the city manager shall immediately arrange a list of such matters case of a tie vote of the commissioners voting on any matter  call to order the presiding officer shall take the chair precisely at the hour appointed for the meeting of the board of commissioners and shall immediately call the board to order  roll call before proceeding with the business of the board of commissioners the city clerk or his deputy may call the roll of the members of the board and the name of those present shall be entered in the minutes  quorum four members of the board of commissioners shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of any business pertaining to the city in the absence of a quorum the presiding officer shall at the instance of any member compel the attendance of absent members  provided however the enactment of any ordinance or resolution or the passage of any motion or the transaction of any business requiring a vote of the board shall require at least four votes of the board  rules of order roberts rules of order newly revised 1970 edition published by scott foresman and company shall govern the board of commissioners in its deliberation in cases not otherwise provided for by statute ordinance rule or regulation debates every member of the board of commissioners desiring to speak shall address the chair and upon recognition by the presiding officer shall confine himself to the question under debate avoiding all personalities and indecorous language  interruptions once recognized a member of the board of commissioners shall not be interrupted when speaking unless it is to call him to order or as otherwise provided in this article while speaking if a member is called to order he shall cease speaking until the question of order is determined and if in order he shall be permitted to proceed  privilege of closing debate the commissioner moving the adoption of an ordinance or resolution shall have the privilege of closing the debate  motion to reconsider a motion to reconsider any action taken by the board of commissioners may be made only on the day such action was taken such motion may be made either immediately during the same session or at a recessed or adjourned session thereof such motion must be made by one of the prevailing side but may be seconded by another member and may be made at any time and have precedence over all other motions or while a member has the floor and it shall be debatable nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent any member of the commission from making or remaking the same or any other motion at a subsequent meeting of the board  remarks of commissioners  when entered in minutes a commissioner may request presiding officer the privilege of having an abstract of his statement on any subject under consideration by the board of commissioners entered in the minutes upon such request such statement shall be entered in the minutes  synopsis of debate  when entered in minutes the clerk may be directed by the presiding officer with the consent of the board of commissioners to enter in the minutes a synopsis of the discussion on any question coming regularly before the board  addressing the board of commissioners any person desiring to address the board of commissioners shall first secure the permission of the presiding officer to do so  provided however that unless the presiding officer rules otherwise any qualified person may address the board of commissioners under the following headings of business without securing such prior permission 1 written communications interested parties or other authorized representatives may address the board of commissioners by written communications in regard to matters that are under discussion 2 oral communications taxpayers or residents of the city or their authorized legal representatives may address the board of commissioners by oral communication on any matter concerning the citys business or over which the board of commissioners has control  provided however that preference shall be given to those persons who have notified the city manager in advance of their desire to speak in order that such persons may appear on the agenda of the board 3 reading of protest etc interested persons or their authorized representatives may address the board by the reading of protests petitions or communications relating to zoning sewer and street proceedings or similar matters in regard to matters then under consideration  addressing the board of commissioners after motion is made after a motion is made by the board of commissioners no person shall address the board without securing permission of the board to do so  manner of addressing board of commissioners  time limit each person addressing the board of commissioners shall step up in front of the board  give his name and remarks in an audible tone of voice  and unless further time is granted by the board shall limit his address to 15 minutes all remarks shall be addressed to the board as a body and not to any members thereof no person other than the board and the person having the floor shall be permitted to enter into any discussion without the permission of the presiding officer either directly or member of the board no question shall be asked of a board member except presiding officer  silence constitutes affirmative vote unless a member of the board of commissioners states that he is not voting his silence shall be construed and recorded as an affirmative vote  decorumgenerally a by board members while the board of commissioners is in session the members must preserve order and decorum and a member by conversation or otherwise shall neither delay or interrupt the proceedings or the peace of the board nor disturb any member while speaking or refuse to obey the orders of the board or its presiding officer except as otherwise provided in this b by persons any person making personal impertinent or slanderous remarks or who shall become boisterous while addressing the board shall be forthwith barred from further audience before the board by the presiding officer unless permission to continue is granted by a majority vote of the board  sameenforcement the chief of police or the marshal or present to place any person who violates the order and decorum of the meeting under arrest and cause him to be prosecuted under the provisions of this the complaint is to be signed by the presiding officer  adjournment a motion to adjourn shall always be in order and decided without debate  special committees all special committees shall be appointed by the board of commissioners  report of consideration  members may file protests against board action any member of the board of commissioners shall have the right to have the reasons for his dissent from or protest against any action of division 2  downtown development authority footnotes  6  editors note of an ordinance adopted  amended div 2 in its entirety to read as herein set out former div 2  22212224 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from the 1976 213 statement of purpose and declaration of need a there exists in the city an essential need for a downtown development authority to revitalize and redevelop the city to promote trade commerce industry and employment opportunities in the city and to likewise promote the general welfare of the public by creating a climate favorable to the location of new industry trade and commerce and to foster the further development of existing industry trade and commerce within the city b the revitalization and redevelopment of the central business district of the city of jesup is essential to develop and promote for the public good and general welfare trade commerce industry and employment opportunities and promote the general welfare of this city by maintaining a climate favorable to the location of new industry trade and commerce and the development of existing industry trade and commerce within the city c it is therefore in the public interest and is vital to the public welfare of the people of this city and it is declared to be the public purpose of this division so to revitalize and redevelop the central business districts of the city of jesup d likewise the continued revitalization and redevelopment of the city is in the public interest and vital to the public welfare therefore be it known to all persons that the public purpose of this division is to protect and serve the public interest and the public welfare redevelopment and revitalization of the city e the city has previously created and activated the downtown development authority of jesup georgia under that resolution activating the downtown development authority of the commissioners of the city of jesup georgia dated  the purpose of this division is to restate the provisions governing the said downtown development authority of jesup georgia 1  1 intent and objective it is the intent and objective of this division to continue and perpetuate the downtown development authority of jesup georgia to authorize it to carry out the full range of its powers as provided by the downtown development authorities law of 198 as amended and to promote the downtown development authority of jesup georgia in fulfilling its purposes as stated in such law 1  1 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section or in the alternative if so defined therein shall have the same meaning as set forth in the ocga  36423 as amended from time to time should those definitions differ cost of the project or cost of any project means and includes 1 all costs of acquisition by purchase or otherwise construction assembly installation modification renovation or rehabilitation incurred in connection with any project or any part of any project  2 all costs of real property fixtures or personal property used in or in connection with or necessary for any project or for any facilities related thereto including but not limited to the cost of all land estates for years easements rights improvements water rights connections for utility services fees franchises permits approvals licenses and certificates  the cost of securing any such franchises permits approvals licenses or certificates  and the cost of preparation of any application therefor and the cost of all fixtures machinery equipment furniture and other property used in or in connection with or necessary for any project  3 all financing charges and loan fees and all interest on revenue bonds notes or other obligations of the downtown development authority which accrues or is paid prior to and during the period of construction of a project and during such additional period as the authority may reasonably determine to be necessary to place such project in operation  4 all costs of engineering surveying and architectural and legal services and all expenses incurred by engineers surveyors architects and attorneys in connection with any project  5 all expenses for inspection of any project  6 all fees of fiscal agents paying agents and trustees for bondholders under any trust agreement indenture of trust or similar instrument or agreement  all expenses incurred by any such fiscal agents paying agents and trustees  and all other costs and expenses incurred relative to the issuance of any revenue bonds notes or other obligations for any project  7 all fees of any type charged by the downtown development authority in connection with any project  8 all expenses of or incidental to determining the feasibility or practicability of any project  9 all costs of plans and specifications for any project  10 all costs of title insurance and examinations of title with respect to any project  11 repayment of any loans made for the advance payment of any part of any of the foregoing costs including interest thereon and any other expenses of such loans  12 administrative expenses of the downtown development authority and such other expenses as may be necessary or incidental to any project or the financing thereof or the placing of any project in operation  and 13 the establishment of a fund or funds for the creation of a debt service reserve a renewal and replacement reserve or such other funds or reserves as the downtown development authority may approve with respect to the financing and operation of any project and as may be authorized by any bond resolution trust agreement indenture of trust or similar instrument or agreement pursuant to the provisions of which the issuance of any revenue bonds notes or other obligations of the downtown development authority may be authorized 14 any cost obligation or expense incurred for any of the foregoing purposes shall be a part of the cost of the project and may be paid or reimbursed as such out of proceeds of revenue bonds notes or other obligations issued by the downtown development authority downtown development area means the geographical area within the city of jesup designated as such by the resolution of the commissioners of the city of jesup as modified by any subsequent resolution of the commissioners of the city of jesup project means 1 the acquisition construction installation modification renovation or rehabilitation of land interests in land buildings structures facilities or other improvements located or to be located within the downtown development area and the acquisition installation modification renovation rehabilitation or furnishing of fixtures machinery equipment furniture or other property of any nature whatsoever used on in or in connection with any such land interest in land building structure facility or other improvement all for the essential public purpose of the development of trade commerce industry and employment opportunities in its authorized area of operation  and 2 the provision of financing to property owners for the purpose of installing or modifying improvements to their property in order to reduce the energy or water consumption on such property or to install an improvement to such property that produces energy from renewable resources 3 a project may be for any industrial commercial business office parking public or other use provided that a majority of the directors of the downtown development authority determine by a duly adopted resolution that the project and such use thereof would further the public purpose of this division such term shall include any one or more buildings or structures used or to be used as a notforprofit hospital notforprofit skilled nursing home or notforprofit intermediate care home subject to regulation and licensure by the department of community health and all necessary convenient or related interests in land machinery apparatus appliances equipment furnishings appurtenances site preparation landscaping and physical amenities revenue bonds or bonds means any bonds of the downtown development authority which are authorized to be issued under the constitution and laws of georgia including refunding bonds but not including notes or other obligations of the downtown development authority 1  1 powers the downtown development authority of jesup georgia shall have those powers and fulfill those duties as created imposed and existing under the downtown development authorities to make and execute contracts and other instruments necessary to exercise the powers of the authority any of which contracts may be made with the county or may be made with any one or more municipal corporations in the county and the county and all municipal corporations therein are hereby authorized to enter into contracts with the authority  4 to receive and administer gifts grants and devises 2229 2230  reserved division 3  joint board of tourism footnotes  7  editors note an ordinance adopted jan 15 201  111 did not specify manner of inclusion  hence codification as div 3  22312241 was at the discretion of the editor cross reference taxation ch 90 short title this division will be known and may be cited as the joint board of tourism for the cities of jesup odum and screven and wayne county act  1 definitions and references as used in this division the term cities means the cities of jesup odum and screven which are bodies public and politic in wayne county georgia conventions means that term as defined in ocga  481350 et seq county means wayne county georgia joint board means the new joint board of tourism for the cities of jesup screven and odum and wayne county that is created hereunder special events means events which in the judgment of the joint board will promote tourism in the cities of jesup odum and screven and wayne county georgia tourism means that term as defined in ocga  481350 et seq trade show means that term as defined in ocga  481350 et seq  2 creation of joint board  status tax exemption and sovereign immunity a there is hereby created a new body public and politic to be known as the joint board of tourism for the cities of jesup odum and screven and wayne county hereinafter in this division also referred to as the joint board the joint board is intended to be an agency and instrumentality of the city of jesup and wayne county and a governmental unit for purposes of  of the internal revenue as amended and is intended to be a subordinated entity to the city of jesup and wayne county to the extent necessary under b3eii of the internal revenue as amended b the joint board shall have its principal office in the geographical limits of the city of jesup as amended from time to time and its legal situs or domiciliary for the purposes of this division shall be the said geographical limits of the city of jesup c the exercise of the powers conferred upon the joint board in this division shall constitute essential governmental functions for public purposes the properties of the joint board both real and personal and the income of the joint board are declared to be public properties and income used for the benefit and welfare of the people of the cities of jesup odum and screven and wayne county and not for the purpose of private or corporate benefit and such properties to the extent of the joint boards ownership thereof or other interest therein and all income and obligations of the joint board shall be exempt from all taxes and special assessments of the state of georgia or any city county or other political subdivision thereof the joint board shall have all of the exemptions and exclusions from taxes as are now granted to cities and counties in the state of georgia for the operation of properties or facilities similar to the properties and facilities to be owned or operated or both by the joint board d any action to protect or enforce any rights under the provisions of this division or any suit or action against the joint board shall be brought in the superior court of wayne county georgia e the property of the joint board shall not be subject to levy and sale under legal process f the records of the joint board shall be public records which are subject to ocga  501870 et seq g nothing in this division shall be construed to abridge or change the powers and duties of other authorities departments boards and like agencies of wayne county georgia or the cities of jesup odum or screven  3 members and meetings a the joint board shall consist of eight appointed members who shall serve terms of four years 1 three members shall be appointed by the board of commissioners of wayne county georgia 2 three members shall be appointed by the board of commissioners of the city of jesup georgia 3 one member shall be appointed by the board of commissioners of the city of odum which such member shall be a resident of the city of odum 4 one member shall be appointed by the board of commissioners of the city of screven which such member shall be a resident of the city of screven 5 the city manager of the city of jesup and the county administrator of wayne county georgia shall be ex officio nonvoting members of the joint board b the initial term of the members of the joint board shall end on  c appointments for succeeding terms shall be made in january of the calendar year following expiration of terms with said appointments before effective thereupon d any member may resign at any time by filing a written notice of resignation with the joint board e the joint board shall meet at such times as may be necessary to transact the business coming before it meetings shall be conducted in accordance with roberts rules of order f at the first meeting of the joint board the members shall elect a chairperson a vicechairperson and a secretarytreasurer from its membership thereafter commencing in the year 201 at the first meeting of the joint board and each calendar year thereafter the members shall elect a chairperson a vicechairperson and a secretarytreasurer from its membership for that calendar year the chairperson shall preside at meetings of the joint board the vicechairperson shall preside at meetings in the absence of the chairperson in the absence of both the chairperson and vicechairperson the members present at a meeting shall elect a temporary chairperson to preside at that meeting so long as the chairperson and vicechairperson both remain absent from the meeting g the joint board shall have the right to elect or hire the chief executive officer or program coordinator of the joint board to set the salary or wages of such person to pay a salary or wages to such person and to otherwise set the terms and conditions of the employment of such person h four members shall constitute a quorum official action may be taken by majority vote of those members voting on a matter if a quorum is present and voting on such matter except that the bylaws of the joint board may only be initially adopted or subsequently amended by majority vote of all members all members present at a meeting including the chairperson vicechairperson or any other member presiding at such meeting shall be entitled to vote on all matters that come before the meeting no vacancy on the joint board shall impair the right of the quorum to exercise all the rights and perform all the duties of the joint board i members shall receive no compensation for their services as members of the joint board but may be reimbursed for their proper and reasonable expenses incurred in the performance of their duties subject to any limitations imposed by general law of the state of georgia on the reimbursement of public officials and subject to any limitations which may be contained from time to time in the bylaws of the joint board  4 purpose the purpose of the joint board is to plan coordinate and administer an effective tourism program for wayne county and the cities of jesup odum and screven in such manner as the joint board shall determine to be appropriate all proceeds of the hotelmotel tax excise tax collected by the cities of jesup odum and screven and wayne county which are provided to the joint board shall be expended in compliance with the applicable provisions of state law inclusive of ocga  481351 as amended  5 powers a the joint board shall have all powers allowed by law and consistent with the provisions of this division as are necessary or convenient to
